body:
**document level infinite scroll**

- meant for third party content?  no, for first party (same origin) content for now
  - future proposal would cover third party content
  - potential users have been happy with this solution
- how are we determining limits to help with performance (e.g. 3 or 4 number of articles)
  - for now, we'll try it out with these initial limits and see what the performance is
- is this a new component?
  - yes
  - it requires configuration & we need to decide how much control to give publishers
  - it also has some configurable default UI associated with it (e.g. possibly cards-based approach when you have multiple articles, collapsing dots)
  - John: based on experience, if we get too prescriptive about the UI a lot of publishers will push back on it
- is this a component provided by a third-party recommendation provider?
  - they could provide configuration for the behavior
- name
  - amp-content-discovery is proposal, but should it be something like amp-article-infinite-scroll?
  - people aren't just going to use it for content discovery
  - "chain" would potentially be better
  - people may be confused between amp-list and this component when they are creating AMP pages, name can help with that
  - name will be discussed offline
